title: What happened in the starting year of 1 AD? - Quora

response.answer_text: Lots of things happened, but no one single thing of great importance. The “tradition” was that Jesus was born in 1AD, AD being an abbreviation for Anno Domini, which is Latin for “Year of our Lord”. However, modern theologians and historians are pretty convinced that Jesus was actually born six or seven years earlier, so the numbering is off. People who don’t like the religious association tend to use the term “CE” for Common Era instead of AD, and BCE for Before Common Era instead of the traditional BC (Before Christ). Sidebar: One curiosity is that 1AD follows directly after 1BC. There is no Zero year in between them. So ten years before 5AD would be 6BC. This is because the concept of zero as a number was not invented until the Islamic era, along with a lot of other mathematical and scientific advances that came out of Islamic innovation. This lack of zero is also why Easter Sunday is referred to as the Third Day after Good Friday.

I think this question hits to the heart of reality….time is purely a human construct that via much maneuvering has sort of agreed upon as standard measure…..it should noted other “year ones” could have just as easily have been domoninate and giving light to the fact that our time measure is mailable and not truly indelible or absolute….….but relative…. Time and measure in my esitimatoon is one of wonders of universal cooperation.
